revisionDesc.change: closed paragraph before first page verso; changed spelling to 'partecularly' and added choice encoding
changed placement of question mark in title
updated value for second page break
Annotate George's house; "about the same"; mattyMatty; Peter Doyle; Ellen O'Connor
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p: you dident didn't write how you was partecularlyparticularly that you was about the same but i want to hear all about if you can walk any better and if your leg is any stronger and if you are well enoughf enough to write any in the office and if you go to the ristorant restaurant to your meals so dear waltWalt you can answer all or none just as you feel disposed

o i think sometimes if i could see mattyMatty once more as i used to and tell her all my ups and downs what a comfort it would be to me i never had any one even my own daughters i could tell every thing to as i could her) when you get old like me waltWalt you feel the need of such a friend

george sgeorge's house is progressing they are putting up the brick wall and he is full of business) Lou is come down in the parlor to day her aunt remains here and waits and wont won't let her hardly move arount i wouldent wouldn't be very sorry if aunty wasent wasn't here but i think she expects to stay a long while)

walt if you should have any thing to write to me that you dont don't want the others to see write it on a small peece piece of paper as the letter man brings the letters but waltWalt doo do write as often as you can
give my love to mrsMrs. oconorO'Connor and remember me to peterPeter DoylDoyle

postscript.p: we saw the news of the modoc massacre last sunday Sunday but thought maybee maybe it wasent wasn't true till we got the herald
